title: How to Make Cayenne Pepper Tea

steps.title: Measure 1 tsp.
steps.content: Measure 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of cayenne pepper and place it in a mug. Use less cayenne and work your way up to 1 teaspoon if the full amount is too strong or too hot. If you have not used cayenne on a regular basis, you might find a full teaspoon difficult.

steps.title: Pour hot water over the cayenne.
steps.content: Pour hot water over the cayenne. Try to use water that has almost reached the boiling point.

steps.title: Stir the cayenne and the water until it is dissolved.
steps.content: Stir the cayenne and the water until it is dissolved. You will notice flakes of the cayenne pepper floating in the water, which is fine.

steps.title: Add the juice from half a lemon to the cup.
steps.content: Add the juice from half a lemon to the cup. Stir the lemon juice into the tea.

steps.title: Let the tea cool for 1 or 2 minutes before sipping.
steps.content: Let the tea cool for 1 or 2 minutes before sipping. Once it has cooled to the point that you can hold the mug without burning your hands, it is ready to drink.

steps.title: Taste the cayenne pepper tea.
steps.content: Taste the cayenne pepper tea. Sip it slowly until it is gone. People who drink it in the morning find they have more energy and a faster metabolism throughout the day. Some people drink it before a workout for an additional energy boost.

steps.title: Add other ingredients if you desire.
steps.content: Add other ingredients if you desire. Some people put fresh, peeled ginger in the bottom of the mug and allow it to steep in the hot water before adding the cayenne and the lemon. Ginger can help eliminate harmful bacteria in your body. Try adding molasses or Stevia if you want to sweeten your tea without sugar or sugar substitutes.

steps.title: Start with 10 oz.
steps.content: Start with 10 oz. (283 g) of water. This tea can be consumed hot or cold.

steps.title: Add 2 tbsp.
steps.content: Add 2 tbsp. (28 g) of lemon juice and 2 tbsp. (28 g) of Grade B maple syrup to the water. This maple syrup must not be sweetened or processed. Look for the Grade B designation on the label.

steps.title: Stir in 1/10 tsp.
steps.content: Stir in 1/10 tsp. (0.5 ml) of cayenne pepper.

steps.title: Drink from 6 to 12 servings of this tea every day to detox your body, lose weight and attain better health.
steps.content: Drink from 6 to 12 servings of this tea every day to detox your body, lose weight and attain better health.

steps.title: Refrain from eating any foods or drinking anything else except water and unsweetened tea while you are consuming the cayenne pepper tea as part of a cleansing program.
steps.content: Refrain from eating any foods or drinking anything else except water and unsweetened tea while you are consuming the cayenne pepper tea as part of a cleansing program.

steps.title: Drink the tea for at least 3 days, but no more than 10 days.
steps.content: Drink the tea for at least 3 days, but no more than 10 days. You should begin feeling lighter and healthier.
